definition: to point out/to indicate/to give directions/to show how (to do sth)/to censure/to pick at
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
to gesticulate/to point out/to point the finger of blame
to show sb how to get to the right path
to talk idly about important matters (idiom)/to set the world to rights/to pass judgment on everything

sentences.english: This hand torch, Helios flew before, please him.
sentences.chinese: 這才手執火把，飛到赫利俄斯面前，請他指點迷津。

sentences.english: I'll refer you to the documentation on how that works.
sentences.chinese: 我會指點您去查閱關於如何做這件事的文檔。

sentences.english: The blind read braille with their fingers.
He recommends regular hot water rinses and massaging of the scalp with fingertips.
sentences.chinese: 他建議使用溫熱水漂洗，而且用手指點觸按摩頭皮。

sentences.english: In such an exigence my uncle's advice and assistance would be everything in the world.
sentences.chinese: 情況如此緊急，非請舅父前來協助指點不可。

sentences.english: At the edge of human pointing, Zhang Fei had spent 50 yuan of money.
sentences.chinese: 在邊上人的指點下，張飛足足花了50多元錢。

sentences.english: Who can show the country, take it leisurely and unoppressively?
sentences.chinese: 誰又能指點江山，從容不迫？

sentences.english: Are we all so unintelligent that we need an elitist to comment on national affairs?
sentences.chinese: 我們都是些低能兒，需要精英來指點江山？

sentences.english: Get back to work. There's a team in the office in need of your guidance.
sentences.chinese: 回去工作，辦公室裏還有個團隊等着你指點迷津呢。

sentences.english: At Yang Wenxiu's direction, Li Tongzhong sampled each of the substitute foodstuffs.
sentences.chinese: 按照楊文秀的指點，李銅鐘品嚐了每一種代食品。

sentences.english: At that moment, the embodiment of Laozi as a white beard came to teach the elderly.
sentences.chinese: 就在這時，老子化身爲一個白鬍子老人前來指點。

sentences.english: Please show me which bus I should take to get to the People's Park .
sentences.chinese: 請您指點一下，我到人民公園應乘哪路公共汽車。

sentences.english: They prayed to God for guidance.
sentences.chinese: 他們祈求上帝指點迷津。

sentences.english: Exactly schoolmate youth, in full flower, the direction landscape, encourages the writing.
sentences.chinese: 恰同學少年，風華正茂，指點江山，激揚文字。

sentences.english: You can upload your photos and submit them for comment and critique.
sentences.chinese: 你可以上傳你的照片，讓別人評論和指點。

sentences.english: "Then," said the count, "I refer you to your confessor.
sentences.chinese: “那麼，”伯爵說道，“我指點你去找個懺悔師吧。

definition: to help/to lend a hand/to do a favor/to do a good turn
to ask for guidance/to consult
senior/older generation/precursor
to learn/to study
great master/master
in one's spare time/outside working hours/amateur (historian etc)
entrance door/to enter a door/introduction (to a subject)
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to help/to assist/to support/for sb (i.e. as a help)/hired (as worker)/side (of pail, boat etc)/outer layer/upper (of a shoe)/group/gang/clique/party/secret society
upstairs/(Internet slang) previous poster in a forum thread
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to
to pass by or through
to comment/a point by point commentary
to ask about/to make some inquiries/to ask around
conveniently/in passing/without much extra effort
senior male fellow student or apprentice/son (older than oneself) of one's teacher
